intro: Silene oligantha subsp. oligantha, commonly known as the narrowleaf catchfly, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of North America. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in rocky or sandy soils, often in desert or semi-desert environments. The plant produces small, pink to purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are narrow and linear, adapted to minimize water loss in harsh conditions. Silene oligantha subsp. oligantha is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological role in supporting pollinators.
